spring.overview: Spring in Jackson is slow to arrive. Snow can last into May, especially in Grand Teton National Park and nearby mountain terrain.
conditions: Deep snowpack in the Tetons and Gros Ventre Range
Melting snow may cause soggy trails and muddy roads
Moose, elk, and bear movement increases in the valley
alerts: Wildlife on roads during dawn and dusk

summer.overview: Jackson summers are dry, warm, and stunningly beautiful. Early summer brings lingering snow to high elevation trails.
conditions: Snow on shaded or alpine trails through June
Wildlife activity: bears, elk, bison near roads and trails
alerts: Red Flag Warnings for fire danger
Air Quality Index for wildfire smoke
Lightning storm alerts, especially above treeline

fall.overview: Jackson fall is crisp and brief, with golden aspens and early snow possible as soon as mid-October.
conditions: Stunning fall color (esp. Snake River Valley)
Wildlife migrations: elk, moose, and pronghorn
Snow and frost on trails, especially mornings

winter.overview: Jackson winters are long, cold, and snowy — ideal for skiing but demanding for travelers.

temperatures.low: Frequently single digits or below 0 °F (-18°C or colder)

conditions: Deep snowpack in mountains and parks
Road closures (e.g., Teton Pass, Moose-Wilson Rd)
alerts: Road closure alerts and plowing updates
Wildlife crossing roads during low visibility
